b11ff611-2e5f-4805-a8d8-e8575ea73492.description: Cyborg Security's Threat Hunting - Execution (Level 1) badge certifies that the member has successfully completed all the necessary coursework, and has successfully completed the final validation exercise at the end of the event. The Execution (Level I) credential covers the following topics of execution used by adversaries, and how to use that knowledge to hunt for it, including: Command and Scripting Interpreter, System Services: Service Execution, User Execution: Malicious File.
b11ff611-2e5f-4805-a8d8-e8575ea73492.name: Threat Hunting - Execution (Level 1)

alignments.name: Final Challenge
alignments.description: Once you have completed the workshop component of the assessment, you will be presented with a final validation challenge that will put your knowledge of adversarial execution to the test. Successfully recover the flag proving you have mastered hunting for basic execution.

badge_template_activities.title: To successfully claim your Execution (Level 1) credential, you must first complete Cyborg Security's Threat Hunting Workshop: Hunting for Execution. This hour long workshop introduces individuals to the key elements of execution, how it works work, and why adversaries use it.

afb32873-cae1-438e-a2bf-fb4b7d296b07.description: Join Cyborg Security's expert threat hunters as they dive into the interesting MITRE ATT&CK Tactic of Defense Evasion (TA0005). The workshop will dive into the critical areas of defense evasion, including a brief background and how and why attackers use it. They will then roll up their sleeves and get dirty in the data, including looking at common techniques for defense evasion, what some of the tricks of the trade are, and most importantly how threat hunters can hunt for it
afb32873-cae1-438e-a2bf-fb4b7d296b07.name: Threat Hunting - Defense Evasion (Level 1)

alignments.name: Final Challenge
alignments.description: Once you have completed the workshop component of the assessment, you will be presented with a final validation challenge that will put your knowledge of adversarial defense evasion to the test. Successfully recover the flag proving you have mastered hunting for basic defense evasion.

badge_template_activities.title: To successfully claim your Defense Evasion (Level 1) credential, you must first complete Cyborg Security's Threat Hunting Workshop: Hunting for Defense Evasion. This hour long workshop introduces individuals to the key elements of execution, how it works work, and why adversaries use it.

8c59b69c-54b7-4999-8e81-48f280991723.description: This workshop is designed for managers, executives, and security stakeholders who are looking to start, grow, and improve their organization's threat hunting capabilities. During the workshop, our team will delve into the key components of managing a threat hunting program, including developing a strategy, building a team, and measuring success. We'll also share real-world examples and best practices to help you implement a program that delivers real results.
8c59b69c-54b7-4999-8e81-48f280991723.name: Cyborg Security - Foundational Threat Hunting Management

alignments.name: Top Cover: Threat Hunting Management Workshop

a04077bf-06e0-49c1-8203-080ac54f78d1.description: Cyborg Security's Threat Hunting - Persistence (Level 1) badge certifies that the member has successfully completed all the necessary coursework, and has successfully completed the final validation exercise at the end of the event. The Persistence (Level I) credential covers the following topics of persistence used by adversaries, and how to use that knowledge to hunt for it in an environment, including: Startup Persistence, Windows Service Persistence, & Local Account Persistence
a04077bf-06e0-49c1-8203-080ac54f78d1.name: Threat Hunting - Persistence (Level 1)

badge_template_activities.title: To successfully claim your Persistence (Level 1) credential, you must first complete Cyborg Security's Threat Hunting Workshop: Persistence is Futile. This hour long workshop introduces individuals to the key elements of persistence, how they work, and why adversaries use it.

Once you have completed the workshop component of the assessment, you will be presented with a final validation challenge that will put your knowledge of adversarial persistence to the test. Successfully recover the flags proving you have mastered hunting for basic persistence.
